clinical_study.brief_title: Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability and Validity of the Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the reliability and validity of the Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test the reliability and validity of the Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale. The internal consistency, test-retest reliability, and criterion validity of Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale will be investigated. The internal consistency will be assessed using Cronbach's alpha. Intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) value with 95 % confidence intervals will be calculated for test-retest reliability. The criterion validity of the scale will be determined by assessing the correlation between the Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale and Behavioral Pediatrics Feeding Assessment Scale.

primary_outcome.description: The Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale is used to evaluate feeding disorders. It has 14 items which are scored on a 7 point Likert scale. Seven items are scored from the negative to positive direction, and the other seven from the positive to negative direction. The primary feeder marks each item according to frequency or difficulty level of a particular behaviour or the level of parental concern. The total feeding problem score is obtained by adding the scores for each item after reversing the scores of seven items from negative to positive.

secondary_outcome.description: The Behavioral Pediatrics Feeding Assessment Scale is a widely used parent-report measure of mealtime and feeding behavior. It has 35 items.Greater overall scores indicate higher levels of problematic mealtime and feeding behavior.

arm_group.description: Children with CP who aged between 18 months and 6 years will be evaluated.
Children with typical development who aged between 18 months and 6 years will be evaluated.

intervention.intervention_name: Turkish Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale
intervention.description: The Turkish version of the Montreal Children's Hospital Feeding Scale, and the Behavioral Pediatrics Feeding Assessment Scale will be completed.

study_pop.textblock: Children with cerebral palsy and Children with typical development

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with cerebral palsy
- Children with typical development
- Aged between 18 months- 6 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Who aged under the age of 18 months and above the age of 6 years.
